body_html:
Is this the correct backwards pass? I thought the frechet derivative was the same as forward-mode AD, not backward-mode. Though I could be wrong.
…
On Fri, Jul 13, 2018 at 1:56 AM, Ceveloper ***@***.***> wrote: Implementing the gradient in python could work for me! But let's say I implement a graph in python with this gradient op and they I write the graph to a protobuf file. If I load the graph with the C++ APi, is the optimization going to work? Or there are some disadvantages because of the custom gradient? I hope this is not off-topic. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Is this the correct backwards pass? I thought the frechet derivative was
the same as forward-mode AD, not backward-mode. Though I could be wrong.
…

 implement a graph in python with this gradient op and they I write the
 graph to a protobuf file. If I load the graph with the C++ APi, is the

 custom gradient? I hope this is not off-topic.

body:
Is this the correct backwards pass? I thought the frechet derivative was
the same as forward-mode AD, not backward-mode. Though I could be wrong.

On Fri, Jul 13, 2018 at 1:56 AM, Ceveloper <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Implementing the gradient in python could work for me! But let's say I
> implement a graph in python with this gradient op and they I write the
> graph to a protobuf file. If I load the graph with the C++ APi, is the
> optimization going to work? Or there are some disadvantages because of the
> custom gradient? I hope this is not off-topic.
>
> —
